<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:3.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Item&nbsp;7.01. Regulation FD Disclosure. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Global Coffee Business Transactions Completed on July&nbsp;2, 2015 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On July&nbsp;2, 2015 (the &#147;closing date&#148;), Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. completed transactions to combine our wholly owned coffee businesses
(including our coffee portfolio in France) with those of D.E Master Blenders 1753 B.V. (&#147;DEMB&#148;) to create a new company, Jacobs Douwe Egberts (&#147;JDE&#148;). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Upon closing, the consideration we received for our global coffee businesses was &#128;3.8 billion ($4.2 billion U.S. dollars using spot exchange rates as of
July&nbsp;2, 2015), a 43.5 percent equity interest in JDE and a $275 million receivable related to an expected payment from JDE one year following the closing related to tax formation costs. We also received $76 million of cash related to the
reimbursement of costs we incurred related to separating our coffee businesses. Acorn Holdings B.V., owner of DEMB, holds a 56.5% share in JDE. The cash and equity consideration we received was adjusted from previous estimates to reflect our
retaining our interest in a Korea-based joint venture, Dongsuh Foods Corporation (&#147;DSF&#148;). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">We are currently in the process of determining the
fair value of our investment in JDE as of the closing date. We expect to have a preliminary valuation completed in the third quarter of 2015. The sale proceeds are also subject to further adjustments, including finalization of working capital, net
debt and other sale adjustments. We expect to finalize the sales price and related adjustments by the end of the second quarter of 2016. As a result, the actual amount of consideration we receive and the gain we recognize on the divestiture may
change until we conclude these matters. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Impact of Coffee Transactions on our Ongoing Reporting of GAAP and Non-GAAP Financial Information </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Following the transactions, our snacks net revenues, consisting of biscuits, chocolate, gum and candy, were approximately 85% of our 2014 net revenues
excluding coffee net revenues. By retaining a significant stake in JDE, we will also continue to have a significant contribution from the coffee category. We plan to reflect our divested historical coffee results and future equity earnings from JDE
in results from continuing operations as the coffee category continues to be a significant part of our strategy and net earnings. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On a GAAP reported
basis, we will report our historical global coffee business results as they were originally reported in net revenues, operating income and segment information. Following the closing date, we will report earnings from our 43.5% investment in JDE net
of tax and separate from operating income as they will be presented after the provision for income taxes line on our consolidated statement of net earnings. We will apply the equity method of accounting and related reporting requirements for our
interest in JDE. In addition, we will begin to report our other equity method investment earnings the same way as we will report on JDE&#146;s after-tax earnings. As a result, it will be more difficult to compare our past and future GAAP reported
business results. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In order to facilitate comparisons of past and future operating results, in our non-GAAP financial information, we will remove from
Organic Net Revenue and Adjusted Operating Income the results of our historical coffee business, DSF and other equity method investments and show those results on the same after-tax earnings basis that we will show future JDE investment earnings.
Our historical Adjusted EPS will not change. However, our Organic Net Revenues and Adjusted Operating Income will change as we reclassify historical coffee results, DSF and other equity method investment income out of these measures in the
accompanying pro forma adjusted financial information. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">See Exhibit 99.1 for the unaudited pro forma adjusted financial information for quarterly
operating results for 2014 through the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. </P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Use of Non-GAAP financial information as Supplemental Information </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">We use certain non-GAAP financial information to budget, make operating and strategic decisions and evaluate our performance. We have disclosed non-GAAP
financial information in our past quarterly and annual reports so that you have the same financial data that we use to make comparisons with our historical operating results and analyze our underlying performance. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">We believe that the presentation of the enclosed pro forma adjusted non-GAAP financial information, when considered together with our U.S. GAAP financial
results, provides you with additional information to evaluate the factors and trends affecting our underlying businesses. Our use of non-GAAP financial information is not meant to be considered in isolation or as a substitute for our U.S. GAAP
financial results. A limitation of the non-GAAP financial information is it may exclude items which have an impact on U.S. GAAP reported results. The best way this limitation can be addressed is by evaluating our non-GAAP financial information in
combination with our U.S. GAAP reported results and carefully evaluating each reconciling item. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Item&nbsp;9.01. Financial Statements and Exhibits.
</B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) The following exhibits are being filed with this Current Report on Form 8-K. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>EX-99.1</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><B>Exhibit 99.1 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Unaudited Pro Forma Non-GAAP Financial Information </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Divestiture of Mondel&#275;z International Coffee Business </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On July&nbsp;2, 2015 (the &#147;closing date&#148;), Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. completed transactions to combine our wholly owned coffee businesses
(including our coffee portfolio in France) with those of D.E Master Blenders 1753 B.V. (&#147;DEMB&#148;) to create a new company, Jacobs Douwe Egberts (&#147;JDE&#148;). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Upon closing, the consideration we received for our global coffee businesses was &#128;3.8 billion ($4.2 billion U.S. dollars using spot exchange rates as of
July&nbsp;2, 2015), a 43.5 percent equity interest in JDE and a $275 million receivable related to an expected payment from JDE one year following the closing related to tax formation costs. We also received $76 million of cash related to the
reimbursement of costs we incurred related to separating our coffee businesses. Acorn Holdings B.V., owner of DEMB, holds a 56.5% share in JDE. The cash and equity consideration we received was adjusted from previous estimates to reflect our
retaining our interest in a Korea-based joint venture, Dongsuh Foods Corporation (&#147;DSF&#148;). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">We are currently in the process of determining the
fair value of our investment in JDE as of the closing date. We expect to have a preliminary valuation completed in the third quarter of 2015. The sale proceeds are also subject to further adjustments, including finalization of working capital, net
debt and other sale adjustments. We expect to finalize the sales price and related adjustments by the end of the second quarter of 2016. As a result, the actual amount of consideration we receive and the gain we recognize on the divestiture may
change until we conclude these matters. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Unaudited Pro Forma Non-GAAP Financial Information </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The following unaudited pro forma non-GAAP financial information reflects adjustments to our historical non-GAAP financial results related to our global coffee
businesses: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Reclassification to remove our historical global coffee business operating results from our historical Organic Net Revenue and Adjusted Operating Income to facilitate comparisons of past and future operating results and
net earnings; historical global coffee business after-tax earnings reclassified to equity method investment earnings. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Reclassification of our historical equity method investment earnings from DSF and other entities from pre-tax Adjusted Operating Income to after-tax equity method investment earnings. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The unaudited pro forma adjusted financial information (i)&nbsp;is presented based on information currently available, (ii)&nbsp;is intended for informational
purposes only, (iii)&nbsp;is not necessarily indicative of and does not purport to represent what our operating results would have been had the global coffee transactions occurred as described or what our future operating results will be after
giving effect to these events, and (iv)&nbsp;does not reflect all actions that may be undertaken by management after the divestiture of our global coffee businesses. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The unaudited pro forma non-GAAP financial information and the accompanying notes should be read together with (i)&nbsp;the audited consolidated financial
statements and accompanying notes and <I>Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations </I>included in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, and (ii)&nbsp;the unaudited
interim consolidated financial statements and accompanying notes and <I>Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations </I>included in our Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q for the quarters beginning
March&nbsp;31, 2014 through March&nbsp;31, 2015 and the Form 10-Q we will file for the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. </P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Notes to the Pro Forma Non-GAAP Financial Statements </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Historical Reported GAAP to Non-GAAP Adjustments </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In
addition to reporting our GAAP operating results, we have historically reported the following non-GAAP adjustments. We believe non-GAAP financial information is useful to investors as it provides additional information to facilitate comparisons of
historical operating results, identify trends in our underlying operating results and provide additional transparency on how we evaluate our business. We use certain non-GAAP financial measures to budget, make operating and strategic decisions and
evaluate our performance. In addition to our GAAP operating results, we have disclosed non-GAAP financial measures so that you have the same financial data that we use to assist you in making comparisons to our historical operating results and
analyzing our underlying performance. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Refer also to our Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q for the periods presented for additional information on these
adjustments. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Spin-Off Costs </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On
October&nbsp;1, 2012, we completed the Spin-Off of our North American grocery business, Kraft Foods Group, Inc. (&#147;Kraft Foods Group&#148;), to our shareholders (the &#147;Spin-Off&#148;). Historically, we incurred Spin-Off transaction,
transition and financing and related costs (&#147;Spin-Off Costs&#148;) in our operating results. In 2014, we completed our Spin-Off transition plans. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>2012-2014 Restructuring Program </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In 2012, our
Board of Directors approved $1.5 billion of restructuring and related implementation costs (&#147;2012-2014 Restructuring Program&#148;) reflecting primarily severance, asset disposals and other manufacturing one-time costs. The primary objective of
the 2012-2014 Restructuring Program was to ensure that Mondel&#275;z International and Kraft Foods Group were each set up to operate efficiently and execute on their respective business strategies upon separation in the Spin-Off and in the future.
Of the $1.5 billion of 2012-2014 Restructuring Program costs, we retained approximately $925 million and Kraft Foods Group retained the balance of the program. Through the end of 2014, we incurred total restructuring and related implementation
charges of $899 million and completed incurring planned charges on the program. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Global Coffee Transaction Incremental costs and Hedging Gains /
Losses </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On July&nbsp;2, 2015, we completed transactions to combine our wholly owned coffee businesses (including our coffee portfolio in France)
with those of D.E Master Blenders 1753 B.V. to create a new company, Jacobs Douwe Egberts (&#147;JDE&#148;). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">To lock in an expected U.S. dollar value of
approximately $5 billion related to the estimated &#128;4 billion cash consideration we would receive from JDE upon closing, we entered into currency exchange forward contracts beginning in May 2014, when the transaction was announced. Cumulatively
over 2014 and through July&nbsp;6, 2015, we realized aggregate net gains and received cash of approximately $1.0 billion on these currency exchange forward contracts. With the receipt of &#128;3.8 billion on July&nbsp;2, 2015 ($4.2 billion using
spot exchange rates as of July&nbsp;2, 2015), we have collected $5.2 billion related to the global coffee transactions. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the second quarter of
2015, we also entered into currency exchange forward contracts to hedge a portion of the cash payments to be made to our subsidiaries in multiple countries where coffee net assets and shares were divested. These hedges with a notional value of
&#128;1.6 billion generated net unrealized gains of $21 million during the three months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. During July 2015, we settled these forward contracts and realized total pre-tax net gains of $17 million. </P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">We also incurred incremental expenses related to readying our global coffee businesses for the transactions. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Divestiture </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On April&nbsp;23, 2015, we completed
the divestiture of our 50 percent interest in AGF to our joint venture partner, which generated a pre-tax gain of $13 million and after-tax loss of $9 million. We did not divest any businesses during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Acquisitions and acquisition-related costs </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On
July&nbsp;15, 2015, we acquired a biscuit operation in Vietnam, and we will begin to account for the acquisition in the third quarter of 2015. On February&nbsp;16, 2015, we also acquired a U.S. snacking company, Enjoy Life Foods. During 2015, we
recorded acquisition-related costs related to these acquisitions. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Integration Program and other acquisition integration costs </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Integration Program costs </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">We completed the integration of
our Cadbury acquisition and ceased accruing program charges in 2013. In 2014, we recorded reversals of $1 million in the three months and $3 million in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2014 related to accruals no longer required. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Other acquisition integration costs </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Other acquisition
integration costs relate to the July 2015 acquisition of a biscuit operation in Vietnam, the February 2015 acquisition of Enjoy Life Foods and the February 2013 acquisition of a biscuit operation in Morocco. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>2014-2018 Restructuring Program </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On May&nbsp;6,
2014, our Board of Directors approved a $3.5 billion restructuring program, comprised of approximately $2.5 billion in cash costs and $1 billion in non-cash costs (&#147;2014-2018 Restructuring Program&#148;), and up to $2.2 billion of capital
expenditures. The primary objective of the 2014-2018 Restructuring Program is to reduce our operating cost structure in both supply chain and overhead costs. The program is intended primarily to cover severance as well as asset disposals and other
manufacturing-related one-time costs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Remeasurement of Venezuelan net monetary assets </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">As prescribed by U.S. GAAP for highly inflationary economies, we have been accounting for the results of our Venezuelan subsidiaries using the U.S. dollar as
the functional currency since January&nbsp;1, 2010. In the first quarter of 2015, we recognized a pre-tax $11 million remeasurement loss reflecting an increase in the SICAD exchange rate from 11.50 to 12.00 bolivars to the U.S. dollar. During the
three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2014, we also recorded a pre-tax $142 million currency remeasurement loss related to the devaluation of our net monetary assets in Venezuela at that time. Through December&nbsp;31, 2014, we recognized $25 million of
additional remeasurement charges related primarily to changes in the SICAD I rate. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Loss on debt extinguishment and related costs </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On March&nbsp;20, 2015, we completed a cash tender offer and retired $2.5 billion of our outstanding high coupon long-term U.S. dollar debt. We recorded a
pre-tax loss on debt extinguishment and related expenses of $713 million during the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2015, for the amount paid in excess of the carrying value of the debt and from recognizing unamortized discounts and deferred
financing costs (including deferred cash flow hedges). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On February&nbsp;6, 2014, we completed a cash tender offer and retired $1.6 billion our
outstanding high coupon long-term U.S. dollar debt. We recorded a pre-tax loss on debt extinguishment and related expenses of $495 million during the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2014, for the amount paid in excess of the carrying value of the
debt and from recognizing unamortized discounts and deferred financing costs. </P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Loss related to interest rate swaps </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2015, we recognized a pre-tax loss of $34 million related to certain U.S. dollar interest rate swaps that we no
longer designate as accounting cash flow hedges due to a change in financing and hedging plans. In the first quarter, our plans to issue U.S. dollar debt changed and we issued euro, British pound sterling and Swiss franc-denominated notes due to
lower overall cost and our decision to hedge a greater portion of our net investments in operations that use these currencies as their functional currencies. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Accounting Calendar Change </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In connection with
moving toward a common consolidation date across the company, in the first quarter of 2015, we changed the consolidation date for our North America segment from the last Saturday of each period to the last day of each period and reported a favorable
impact of $39 million on net revenues and $19 million on operating income for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Constant currency
</I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Management evaluates the operating performance of the company and our international subsidiaries on a constant currency basis. We determine our
constant currency operating results by dividing or multiplying, as appropriate, the current period local currency operating results by the currency exchange rates used to translate our financial statements in the comparable prior year period to
determine what the current period U.S. dollar operating results would have been if the currency exchange rate had not changed from the comparable prior year period. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Pro Forma Adjustments </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">We have also made pro forma
adjustments to our historical reported non-GAAP financial information to reclassify the results of our historical global coffee businesses and equity method investments as described below. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Reclassification of historical global coffee business net revenues and net earnings </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">We removed our historical global coffee business operating results from our historical Organic Net Revenue and Adjusted Operating Income and reclassified
historical global coffee business after-tax earnings to equity method investment earnings to facilitate comparisons of past and future operating results and net earnings. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Reclassification of equity method investment earnings </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Historically, we have recorded income from equity method investments within our operating income as these investments operated as extensions of our base
business. Beginning in the third quarter of 2015, to align with the accounting for JDE earnings, we will also begin to reclassify the earnings from DSF and these other entities from operating income to equity method investment earnings. For our
historical Adjusted Operating Income results, we have reclassified the equity method investment earnings from Adjusted Operating Income to equity method investment earnings in all historical periods presented. </P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Reconciliation of GAAP to Non-GAAP Measures </P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Net Revenues </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">(in millions of U.S.

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Reconciliation of GAAP to Non-GAAP Measures </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Gross Profit / Operating Income </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">(in millions of U.S. dollars) (Unaudited) </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="18" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"><B>For the Three Months Ended September&nbsp;30, 2014</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><U>Schedule 3.4 </U></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Reconciliation of GAAP to Non-GAAP Measures </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Condensed Consolidated Statements of Earnings </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">(in millions of U.S. dollars, except per share data) (Unaudited) </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>

<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Reconciliation of GAAP to Non-GAAP Measures </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Segment Data </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">(in millions of U.S.
dollars) (Unaudited) </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

dollars) (Unaudited) </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
